title: How to Quickly Delete a Walmart Account

steps.title: Open up the Walmart app on your phone.
steps.content: Open up the Walmart app on your phone. Make sure that you’re signed in to the account you’d like to close down.

steps.title: Hit the Account option.
steps.content: Hit the Account option. You can find it in the bottom-right corner of the main screen within the app.

steps.title: Scroll to the end of the page and hit Delete Account.
steps.content: Scroll to the end of the page and hit Delete Account . It should be the very last option at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Complete the app’s instructions to finalize the deletion.
steps.content: Complete the app’s instructions to finalize the deletion. The app will ask you sign in again, and may provide a few more on-screen instructions. Follow these, and your Walmart account should be deleted.

steps.title: Call 1-800-966-6546 to cancel your Walmart account.
steps.content: Call 1-800-966-6546 to cancel your Walmart account. According to Walmart’s built-in chat service, calling Walmart’s customer support team at 1-800-966-6546 can help you get your Walmart account shut down. Keep in mind that it’s no longer possible to close your account via chat. Make sure you’re calling this number and not Walmart’s main line.

steps.title: Computer
steps.content: Computer Hover over the “Account” button in the top-right corner of the screen and click on “Walmart+” from the drop-down menu. Choose “Manage Membership,” followed by “Cancel Membership.” Walmart will give you a “Remind Me Later” option, in which their system shoots you a cancellation reminder 3 days before your Walmart+ membership would be canceled. [1] X Research source

steps.title: App
steps.content: App Tap the “Account” button in the bottom-right corner of the app. Then, scroll down to the “Subscriptions & plans” section of the page. Tap the “Walmart+” option, and then tap the gear icon in the top-right corner of the next screen. Head to the bottom of this page to find the “Cancel membership” option, which sits beneath the “Pause membership” button.
